page.title: Intel PRO/Wireless 5000 LAN 3A Mini PCI Adapter

revision.text:

|vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 0007 |subvendor_id = 8086 |subdevice_id = 2501 |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = J3OWM3A5000 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |boardid = 200-0941-001 |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = 00:05:3C

|antconn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 5 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->

|availability = EoL |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 05/24/2002 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "Xircom" and "200-0941-001 REV1" is silkscreened on the module in the FCC internal photos.
The OUI used by this device is presumed to the standard Xircom ID used by other early Intel devices of this era (00:05:3C).
[[Category:English Documentation]]
